page.title: 07 Recreation at Radcot
page.content: On a summer's afternoon the area around the bridges may be crowded with visitors. People swim and paddle in the water by Navigation Bridge, or follow the public footpath along to Radcot Lock. Narrowboat trips are available from May to October: the "Battersea" and "Vanguard" make scheduled trips but are also available for private outings. This is a very popular fishing location, season tickets at 5 pounds each are available to the many anglers who fish here all year round. One pound day-permits are available from the Swan Inn. All coloured maggots have been banned from these waters since June 1984. Radcot Angling Club arranges matches and competitions. Pike, Bream, Brown Trout, Carp and Chub are reputedly in good supply.
